name: Sleep Test ðŸ’¤ðŸ’¤ðŸ’¤
header:
SETUP_SLEEP=2

NUM_JOBS=10
# Amount of time each job will sleep
SLEEP_MIN=5
SLEEP_MAX=30

# Number of jobs which should fail
SHOULD_FAIL=1

CLEANUP_SLEEP=10
setupScript:
echo "We're setting up!"

for i in $(seq 1 $SETUP_SLEEP); do
  sleep 1
  echo $i/$SETUP_SLEEP
done

echo "All done setting up..."
setupScriptSlurmConfig:
#SBATCH -n 1 # number of tasks to use (usually 1)
#SBATCH -c 1 # number of threads you are going to use
#SBATCH -p main # main partition
#SBATCH --qos debug # queue to enter
loopWrapperTop:
i=0
for word in $(cat /usr/share/dict/words | sort -R | head -n $NUM_JOBS); do
jobTemplate:
echo "This is job $(($i+1)) (known as $word)"

delta=$(( $SLEEP_MAX - $SLEEP_MIN ))
stime=\$(( \$RANDOM % \$delta + $SLEEP_MIN ))

echo "Sleeping for \$stime seconds..."
for j in \$(seq 1 \$stime); do
  sleep 1
  echo \$j/\$stime
done

if (( $i < $SHOULD_FAIL )); then
  echo "I'm failing, per request..."
  exit $(($i+1))
fi

echo "And done!"
slurmTemplate:
#SBATCH -n 1 # number of tasks to use (usually 1)
#SBATCH -c 1 # number of threads you are going to use
#SBATCH -p main # main partition
#SBATCH --qos debug # queue to enter
cleanupScript:
echo "And cleaning up!"

for i in $(seq 1 $CLEANUP_SLEEP); do
  sleep 1
  echo $i/$CLEANUP_SLEEP
done

echo "All done cleaning up..."
cleanupSlurmConfig:
#SBATCH -n 1 # number of tasks to use (usually 1)
#SBATCH -c 1 # number of threads you are going to use
#SBATCH -p main # main partition
#SBATCH --qos debug # queue to enter
